title: John Terry's mansion burgled while star on family ski holiday - were raiders tipped off by Instagram photo?
text:
The Instagram photo that may have tipped off John Terry burglars (Photo: Instagram) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Burglars have raided former England skipper John Terry’s luxury mansion while he was on a family ski holiday, it has been reported. 
The gang may have struck after seeing holiday snaps posted by the ex-England skipper on his Instagram account, it is feared. 
John, 36, and wife Toni, 35, are said to be “very shaken” after raiders plundered thousands of pounds worth of personal items including jewellery from the couple’s £5 million Surrey home. Instagram 
An Instagram picture of their trip to the slopes indicated they were on holiday — and friends fear that them more vulnerable to a break-in. 
The raiders are believed to have struck last Saturday after sneaking past security at the gated estate, The Sun reported. 
Detectives investigating the break-in are trying to establish if Terry’s home was specifically picked. 
A source said: “It’s a very real possibility that these burglars have seen some of their posts. 
“It’s like a catalogue for would-be thieves, and even played a part when Kim Kardashian was robbed in Paris.” John Terry and his wife Toni in the Maldives on a previous holiday (Photo: Instagram/johnterry.26) 
The Terrys have reportedly now upgraded their security systems with extra patrols. 
The £5million mock Georgian property has been home to the veteran defender’s family for three years. 
It previously belonged to golf star Colin Montgomerie. John and Toni Terry at the London Football Awards last year (Photo: Phil Lewis/WENN.com) 
The break-in forced John to pull out of The London Football Awards on Thursday night, where he was expected to present a prize to his pal and former teammate Frank Lampard. 
Stalwart Terry’s latest deal is up this summer and has been linked to a lucrative move to China. 
He is no longer a first-choice pick at Stamford Bridge but said: “I’m not sure [if I would move to China]. 
"For me, I want to stay at Chelsea.” 
The Mirror has contacted Surrey Police for comment. Like us on Facebook
